meanings.definition: To deprive of possession or occupancy
meanings.sent1: The landlord disseizes the tenant of the apartment keys.
meanings.sent2: The government disseizes the land from the owner for public use.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel disseizes the birds of their nests for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm disseizes the trees of their leaves in a swift motion.
meanings.sent5: The thief disseizes the store of its valuable merchandise under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: To oust or eject from property
meanings.sent1: The new owner disseizes the previous tenants from the house.
meanings.sent2: The court order disseizes the trespassers from the private property.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat disseizes the dog from its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise disseizes my focus from the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The sudden realization disseizes him of his false beliefs about the situation.
